SENT.plain: Pleomorphic xanthoastrocytoma is a rare, cortically based, partially cystic astroglial tumour with a strongly enhancing solid mural nodule
We report an 11-year-old boy with a pleomorphic xanthoastrocytoma in the contralateral hemisphere to that affected by Sturge-Weber syndrome
This unique case supports the association between Sturge-Weber syndrome and astrocytomas
Patients with Sturge-Weber syndrome who experience unexpected neurological symptoms should be evaluated with MRI
